hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave in this episode
1526 a n today's date is March 20th 2018
and the title of the episode is Europe
short on dollars this could trigger a

central bankers they have been pushing
their illusion like they've always done
in the past that the economy is doing
well and there are no problems
whatsoever we're seeing no signs of
recession employment growth is strong
jobless claims are low and the stock
market is up we hear this all the time
it's happening every single day since
2008 and they continually tell us that
things are going to get a lot better we
also see the corporate media now
starting to turn because Trump is
putting forth his economic policies and
we are starting to see that things are
starting to change now the corporate
media and the Fed they were out there
and the government they were out there
saying that the US economy has been
growing by 2% and since it's been
growing at 2% how could we have a
recession anytime soon well if you look
back in time we can see that January of
1980 the US economy grew by one point
four four three percent July 1981 4.3 9%
December 2007 1.8 7% if you look at each
of those dates the economy was clearly
clearly growing but each of those dates
is the growth rate of the economy
immediately prior to the onset of a
recession and if you remember in the
year 2000 the media analysts the
economic community they are all out
there saying listen the economic growth
it's not gonna decline we're gonna see
growth into the foreseeable future
there's no signs what
so ever of any type of recession and
they kept on saying this over and over
and over of course
one year later what did we see we saw a
recession and what we're seeing right
now is that they continually keep us in
this illusion they don't let on to what
is going on they don't want you to know
what's going on until the very end and
of course what they do is they go back
in time a full year later after the
annual data revisions had been released
by the B ei the Bureau of Economic
Analysis the recession was officially
revealed but of course it's too late
we're already in the recession and
they're just telling us what we already
know they always tell us at the back end
oh yeah by the way this is when it
really started and we've learned
something from all of this by looking at
the past and looking at what is
happening today we know three things the
economic number reported today will not
be the same when it is when it is
revised in the future the trend and
deviation of the data are far more
important than a number itself record
highs and lows are records for a reason
as they denote historical turning points
in the data let's look at jobless claims
for instance this is a data series
currently being touted out there that
Wow the job market is incredible it's
the lowest Woo's ever seen there is no

graph showing 2008-2009 all the way up
to today where the trend line is
declining and it's showing that yo we
were at you know 10% unemployment and
now we're down at 4.1 percent they're
gonna say it's gonna go even lower than
that
but if you back up a little bit and you
open up the graph go them all the way
back to 1967 you can see that there is
definitely a trend that each time
unemployment
reaches a very very low level we enter a
recession or a depression this has
happened in 1971 in 1974 this has
happened in 1982 this has happened in
1990 this has happened in 2001 2000 2001
this has happened in 2007 2008 and we
are at the lowest point since 1974 maybe
even 71 right now and this tells us this
next crash it's going to be a lot worse
than before
then if we go and we look at retail

see that well retail sales they are not

now we are in a downward trend we were
in a downward trend starting in 2006
going into 2007 it picked up speed in
2008 and it was a complete disaster if
we go back to 2000 that's when the

2001 it declined we entered a recession
here we are again in 2017 I mean 2018
and we see the same exact trend we are
declining right now the same thing has
happened in the past there's no
difference the only difference is we're
much worse off because they have created
this illusion the other interesting

personal income what is interesting to
note is the rising level of credit card
debt required to sustain retail sales so
basically more people have to use credit
just to keep retail where it is which
tells you something so we have low
jobless claims retail sales remaining
exceptionally weak
there are two reasons for this which are
continually overlooked the first is that
despite the longest run of unemployment
growth in US history those who are
finding jobs continues to grow at a
substantially slower pace than the
growth rate of the population if you
don't have a job and a primary living
and primarily living on the government
support which by the way is one of four
Americans receive some form of benefit
it is difficult to consume at higher
levels to support economic growth
secondly while tax cuts may provide a

the higher energy gasoline healthcare
borrowing costs this is why 80% of
Americans continue to live paycheck to

bank it is also why wages have continued
to stagnate the cost of living now
exceeds what incomes and debt increases
can sustain so when we look at this we
can see that this pattern we have seen
this pattern over and over and over
again this time it's not different this

and everything starts to fall apart and

u.s. dollar liquidity in nearly nine

now think about what is happening right
now they're saying that dollars are

well yes they are because Trump right

this was their big big push it is being

if you notice when he came into office

they know that they've been keeping it

States it wasn't working for the people

they've been manipulating gold and
